tool.name: Step 1: Mapping (can be both RIBO-seq or RNA-seq)
tool.command:
mapping.pl --name $experimentname --species $organism --ensembl $ensembl --cores $cores --igenomes_root $igenomes_root.fields.path --readtype $readtype.riboSinPair --readlength $readtype.readlength --splicing $splicing --clipper $clipper --unique $MultiUnique.unique --mismatch $mismatch --adaptor $readtype.adaptor --phix $readtype.phix --rRNA $readtype.rrna
--mapper $choose.mapper --tr_coord $choose.tr_coord
#if $MultiUnique.unique == "N"
--maxmultimap $MultiUnique.maxmultimap --firstrankmultimap $MultiUnique.firstrankmultimap
#end if
#if $readtype.riboSinPair == "ribo"
--snRNA $readtype.snrna --tRNA $readtype.trna --inputfile1 $readtype.input_file1 --inputfile2 $readtype.input_file2 --min_l_parsing $readtype.min_l_parsing --max_l_parsing $readtype.max_l_parsing --out_bg_s_untr "${untreat_s_bg}" --out_bg_as_untr "${untreat_as_bg}" --out_bg_s_tr "${treat_s_bg}" --out_bg_as_tr "${treat_as_bg}" --out_sam_untr "${untreat_sam}" --out_sam_tr "${treat_sam}" --out_bam_untr "${untreat_bam}" --out_bam_tr "${treat_bam}" --out_sqlite "${out_sqlite}" --suite $readtype.plastidStandard.suite --suite_tools_loc "/srv/galaxy/server/tool-data/proteoformer/suite_tools" --price_files $readtype.price_files
#if $choose.tr_coord == "Y" --out_bam_tr_untr "${untreat_bam_tr}" --out_bam_tr_tr "${treat_bam_tr}" #end if
#if $readtype.plastidStandard.suite == "plastid" --min_l_plastid $readtype.plastidStandard.min_l_plastid --max_l_plastid $readtype.plastidStandard.max_l_plastid --offset_img_untr $p_offsets_untr --offset_img_tr $p_offsets_tr #end if #else if $readtype.riboSinPair == "ribo_untr"
--snRNA $readtype.snrna --tRNA $readtype.trna --inputfile1 $readtype.input_file1 --min_l_parsing $readtype.min_l_parsing --max_l_parsing $readtype.max_l_parsing --out_bg_s_untr "${ribo_untr_s_bg}" --out_bg_as_untr "${ribo_untr_as_bg}" --out_sam_untr "${ribo_untr_sam}" --out_bam_untr "${ribo_untr_bam}" --out_sqlite "${ribo_untr_out_sqlite}" --suite $readtype.plastidStandard.suite --suite_tools_loc "/srv/galaxy/server/tool-data/proteoformer/suite_tools" --price_files $readtype.price_files
#if $choose.tr_coord == "Y" --out_bam_tr_untr "${ribo_untr_bam_tr}" #end if
#if $readtype.plastidStandard.suite == "plastid" --min_l_plastid $readtype.plastidStandard.min_l_plastid --max_l_plastid $readtype.plastidStandard.max_l_plastid --offset_img_untr $ribo_p_offsets_untr #end if #else if $readtype.riboSinPair == "PE_polyA"
--inputfile1 $readtype.input_file1 --inputfile2 $readtype.input_file2 --out_bg_s_untr $PE_polyA_s_bg --out_bg_as_untr $PE_polyA_as_bg --out_sam_untr $PE_polyA_sam --out_sqlite $PE_polyA_out_sqlite --truseq $truseq
#if $choose.tr_coord == "Y" --out_bam_tr_untr "${PE_polyA_bam_tr}" #end if #else if $readtype.riboSinPair == "PE_total"
--inputfile1 $readtype.input_file1 --inputfile2 $readtype.input_file2 --out_bg_s_untr $PE_total_s_bg --out_bg_as_untr $PE_total_as_bg --out_sam_untr $PE_total_sam --out_sqlite $PE_total_out_sqlite --truseq $truseq #if $choose.tr_coord == "Y" --out_bam_tr_untr "${PE_total_bam_tr}" #end if #else if $readtype.riboSinPair == "SE_polyA"
--inputfile1 $readtype.input_file1 --out_sam_untr $SE_polyA_sam --out_sqlite $SE_polyA_out_sqlite --out_bg_s_untr $SE_polyA_s_bg --out_bg_as_untr $SE_polyA_as_bg --truseq $truseq #if $choose.tr_coord == "Y" --out_bam_tr_untr "${SE_polyA_bam_tr}" #end if #else if $readtype.riboSinPair == "SE_total"
--inputfile1 $readtype.input_file1 --out_sam_untr $SE_total_sam --out_sqlite $SE_total_out_sqlite --out_bg_s_untr $SE_total_s_bg --out_bg_as_untr $SE_total_as_bg --truseq $truseq #if $choose.tr_coord == "Y" --out_bam_tr_untr "${SE_total_bam_tr}" #end if #end if

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool uses transcriptome mappers (STAR or TopHat2) to map RIBO-seq or RNA-seq next-generation sequencing reads against the reference genome using Ensembl annotation bundles (from the corresponding IGenomes: http://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.ilmn).
*For RIBO-seq*
1) The footprints are mapped
both the NGS-reads of the untreated, cycloheximide (CHX), or emetine (EMT) sample
and the NGS-reads of the treated: puromycin (PUR), harringtonine (HAR), or lactimidomycin (LTM)
2) The footprint alignments are assigned to specific A site nucleotides by using standard or calculated (with the help of Plastid) offsets
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
*For RIBO-seq*
DATA1 = Untreated, CHX, or EMT treated sample
DATA2 = PUR, HARR, or LTM treated sample ::
A sam alignment file holding the DATA1 alignments A sam alignment file holding the DATA2 alignments A bam alignment file holding the DATA1 alignments A bam alignment file holding the DATA2 alignments A bedgraph holding the sense DATA1 ribo-seq footprint count data A bedgraph holding the antisense DATA1 ribo-seq footprint count data A bedgraph holding the sense DATA2 ribo-seq footprint count data A bedgraph holding the antisense DATA2 ribo-seq footprint count data An sqlite database holding all experimental data
Optional: A bam alignment file holding the DATA1 alignments based on transcriptome coordinates A bam alignment file holding the DATA2 alignments based on transcriptome coordinates
If Plastid offset option was chosen: A png figure showing the DATA1 calculated P-site offsets A png figure showing the DATA1 calculated P-site offsets
*For RNA-seq*
Only a selection of these files will be generated
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
A FastQ file holding the DATA1
A FastQ file holding the DATA2, if necessary depending on the experiment type (Ribo-seq, RNA-seq, Ribo-seq untreated only,...)
------

For the underlying tool and it's use in Galaxy, please cite http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/nar/gku1283
